messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, my name's Mickey. I'm the manager at the McDonald's on Vine Street.
What's going on, Mickey?
There's a woman here; she has a gun.
She has a gun?
Yes, and I need to evacuate the whole building.
Okay, where is she at? Is she inside?
She's right here in front of me.
Okay, tell me what she looks like.
She's about five-three, maybe 120 pounds, brown hair, maybe 45 to 50 years old.
And she's standing right in front of you?
Yes.
Just stay on the phone with me, okay?
Okay.
And you're at the first counter?
Yes, right at the first counter.
Does she say what's wrong with her?
No, she said she doesn't want anybody to come in, that she wants to talk to somebody outside.
Will she go outside when they get there?
I'll go halfway. She said I have to stay with her.
Okay, what is your name?
My name's Mickey.
Mickey, who else is in there?
Right now I have customers and about 10 crew people.
I need you to get everyone to leave. Can you do that?
I'm going to lock the doors. I've got some people coming out.
Are there any other employees in there?
Yes, there are other employees in the back.
I'm going to ask them to leave, okay? Stand by.
I'm trying to get everyone out. She is still with me at the front of the store.
Will she tell you her name?
Her name is Noelle.
Okay, does she want to talk to the police or anyone else?
She wants to talk to someone in person but does not want to come outside.
Can you describe what she's wearing?
I'm not sure; she's standing behind me.
Are the employees heading out the side door?
Yes, they are.
Keep them going, don't let anyone else inside.
Noelle, do you want to tell me what's going on?
I just want to make a statement.
Does she want to talk to a police officer?
Yes, she wants to talk to a police officer at the door.
Can you see if she has a gun on her?
It's in my back.
Okay, Mickey, just stay calm and keep listening to me. We're going to help you both.
Noelle says she has mental illness and she's been struggling.
Mickey, just keep her calm. Let her talk and keep listening to her.
Noelle, you're going to be okay.
I've had these feelings of paranoia, like people are in my apartment.
Mickey, is she still standing behind you?
Yes, she wants me to go outside now.
Do you feel safe doing that?
As long as she comes with me.
Okay, stay on the phone with me as long as you can.
We're outside. I don't want to hurt anybody.
Stay calm and keep talking to her.
Mickey? Are you still there?
Yes, we're outside but far from the phone.
Stay on the phone as long as you can. Help is on the way.
I hear shots.
What is happening now?
More shots. People are down.
Stay calm, Mickey. Rescue is coming.
Mickey, stay on the phone. Where are you now?
I'm in the parking lot. All employees are out and safe.
Stay with your crew. Go near their cars and wait for the officers.
Okay, the officers are calling me over.
Alright, Mickey. Go talk to the officers. You're safe now.
Thank you.
You're welcome. Take care.
